title: Core dump
body: The program core dumps when I run it on a training set. If you need, I can provide the input files.

title: Training exits prematurely
body:
FStitch train exists without writing parameter file. Here's the output:


title: Unsure how to use the strand paramater. If I give no strand paramater when segmenting I get only the forward strand. If I used -s neg I get only the forward strand. If I used -s - then it says Unknown user option: -.
F-stitch Learning rate not converging in C.elegans data
body:

reading in training file.............................done

running Newton's Method for Logistic Regression......Warning: Learning Algorithm did not converge...
Consider increasing number of maximum iterations...
Warning: Learning Algorithm did not converge...
Consider increasing number of maximum iterations...
Warning: Learning Algorithm did not converge...
Consider increasing number of maximum iterations...
Warning: Learning Algorithm did not converge...
Consider increasing number of maximum iterations...
The files are too big to post to git hub. Let me know if you need more examples.

title: newer version different output
body: I had just downloaded Fstich on Mar 28 and I re download on Apr 12. The version I downloaded on March 28th is outputting 5000-15,000 regions per sample. The version I download on Apr 12 is reporting >150,000 regions per sample and many of those regions have 0 reads in them.

title: EXIT in NewtonsMethod() and gradient() not pointer or reference
body:
EXIT is passed by value and modified within gradient. These changes shouldn't propagate back to NewtonsMethod, since EXIT is neither a pointer nor a reference.

This occurs in NewtonsMethod.cpp at lines ~510 and 113.
